name: Google Cloud Platform
description: Launch a Weaviate cluster from the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) marketplace. Weaviate integrates with Google Gemini API and Google Vertex AI.
howItWorks: Weaviate integrates with GCP infrastructure and services like Gemini API and Vertex AI.
setup: Deploy Weaviate via GCP Marketplace.
Configure networking & credentials.
Connect to Vertex AI / AI Studio and test.

items.topic: Build a multimodal application using Gemini Flash
items.description: This notebook shows you how to use Weaviate and Gemini Flash to build a multimodal application.

items.topic: BigQuery and Weaviate
items.description: Sync data between BigQuery and Weaviate using DSPy.

items.topic: Semantic Search with Gemini Ultra
items.description: This notebook shows you how to use Weaviate and Gemini Ultra.

items.topic: Weaviate Query Agent with Gemini API
items.description: Use the Query Agent as a tool with the Gemini API.

items.topic: Weaviate Query Agent with Vertex AI
items.description: Use the Query Agent as a tool with Vertex AI.

items.topic: Deploy a Weaviate vector database on GKE
items.description: This tutorial shows you how to deploy a Weaviate vector database cluster on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE).

items.topic: Personalized Product Descriptions with Weaviate and the Gemini API
items.description: Learn how to embed your data, run a semantic search, make a generative call to the Gemini API and store the output back in your database.

items.title: Weaviate on Vertex AI RAG Engine: Building RAG Applications on Google Cloud
items.desc: Learn how to build RAG Applications on Google Cloud using the new RAG Engine on Vertex AI.

name: Amazon Web Services
description: Launch a Weaviate cluster from the Amazon Web Services (AWS) marketplace. AWS supports model provider integrations through SageMaker and Bedrock.
howItWorks: Weaviate integrates with AWS infrastructure and services like Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Bedrock.
setup: Deploy Weaviate via AWS Marketplace.
Configure networking, IAM roles & credentials.
Connect to Bedrock and/or SageMaker and test.

items.topic: RAG with Cohere models on Amazon Bedrock and Weaviate
items.description: The example use case generates targeted advertisements for vacation stay listings based on a target audience.

name: Microsoft Azure
description: Deploy Weaviate on the Azure Marketplace and access models from OpenAI via the Microsoft Azure API.

name: Firecrawl
description: Firecrawl is an AI-first web scraping tool. It allows you to easily crawl and extract clean, structured data from websites. It is an API service that converts a URL into clean markdown or structured data.
howItWorks: Firecrawl handles the complexities of web scraping like proxies, caching, rate limits, and dynamic content. It produces markdown or JSON formatted output that is ready to be ingested into vector databases like Weaviate.
setup: Create a Firecrawl account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Firecrawl integration.
Configure the Weaviate Firecrawl Connector to stream data from Firecrawl to Weaviate.

items.topic: Firecrawl to Weaviate
items.description: This notebook shows you how to scrape webpages with Firecrawl and load their contents into Weaviate.

name: Context Data
description: VectorETL by Context Data is a modular no-code Python framework that is designed to help AI and Data Engineers work with data
list:
1. Quickly extract data from multiple data sources (databases, cloud storage, and local files)
  2. Embed using major models (including OpenAI, Cohere, and Google Gemini)
  3. Write to vector databases
howItWorks: Weaviate is a target connection in Context Data. To connect to Context Data, open the console and input your Weaviate instance's URL and authentication credentials when prompted.
setup: Create a Context Data account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Context Data integration.
Configure the Weaviate Context Data Connector to stream data from Context Data to Weaviate.

items.topic: VectorETL into Weaviate
items.description: Three examples showing you how to ingest data from Google Cloud Storage, Postgres, and S3 into Weaviate.

name: Contextual AI
description: Contextual AI offers a document Parser built for retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems. It enables agents to understand and navigate complex document structures.
list:
1. Quickly extract data from multiple data sources (databases, cloud storage, and local files)
  2. Embed using major models (including OpenAI, Cohere, and Google Gemini)
  3. Write to vector databases
howItWorks: Parsed outputs can be stored in Weaviate for vector and hybrid search, metadata filtering, and RAG.
setup: Create a Contextual AI account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Contextual AI integration.
Configure the Weaviate Contextual AI Connector to stream data from Contextual AI to Weaviate.

items.topic: Contextual AI Parser + Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to use Contextual AI's Parser with Weaviate to build powerful RAG applications over PDF documents.

name: Aryn
description: Aryn is an AI powered ETL system for language model applications and vector databases.
list:
Aryn offers two components:
  1. Aryn Partitioning Service
  2. Sycamore
howItWorks: Weaviate is a supported destination connector in Airbyte. You can set up a source connector to extract data and import it into Weaviate using Airbyte.
setup: Weaviate is a supported connector in Aryn. You can:
Write to Weaviate with write.weaviate()
Read from Weaviate with read.weaviate()

items.topic: Using Aryn to ingest data into Weaviate
items.description: Demo on how to prepare and load data into Weaviate using Sycamore.

items.topic: Enriching and Ingesting Data into Weaviate with Aryn
items.description: Demo on how to ingest PDFs into Weaviate using Aryn.

name: Airbyte
description: Airbyte is an open-source data integration engine that helps you consolidate your data in your data warehouses, lakes and databases. You can use Airbyte to ingest data into Weaviate.
howItWorks: Weaviate is a supported destination connector in Airbyte. You can set up a source connector to extract data and import it into Weaviate using Airbyte.

admonitions.title: CAUTION
admonitions.html: The Weaviate integration on Airbyte uses the v3 Python client and is only compatible with Weaviate Database versions <1.24. To help track requests to update the integration, please open a GitHub issue on Airbyte's repository.

setup: Set up a Python environment.
Deploy a serverless, read-only Weaviate client with Airbyte.
Integrate Airbyte with Weaviate in your application.

items.topic: Unleash to Weaviate
items.description: Load data from Unleash into Weaviate

items.topic: Airtable to Weaviate
items.description: Sync data from Airtable into Weaviate

items.topic: Monday to Weaviate
items.description: Load your data in Monday into Weaviate within minutes.

name: Cardinal
description: Cardinal is a modern document processing platform, powering your data workflows with their custom AI model.
howItWorks: The Cardinal and Weaviate integration lets users automatically process documents through Cardinal, enrich them with bounding boxes and metadata, and insert them into a Weaviate collection for retrieval and generative search.
setup: Create a Cardinal account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Cardinal integration.
Configure the Cardinal connector in Weaviate to access your Cardinal files.
Ingest and index your Cardinal documents into Weaviate for semantic search and RAG capabilities.

items.topic: Cardinal ↔ Weaviate RAG Demo
items.description: Grab documents from S3, process each file using Cardinal, and run retrieval and generative queries.

name: Confluent
description: Confluent is a fully managed Apache Kafka service that offers real-time data streaming, seamless integration across major cloud providers, high performance, and robust security features.
howItWorks: Stream data from Confluent Cloud to Weaviate with the Weaviate Confluent Connector. For setup and usage details, see the connector README.
setup: Create a Confluent account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Confluent integration.
Configure the Weaviate Confluent Connector to stream data from Confluent to Weaviate.

items.topic: PySpark Notebook
items.description: Learn how to use PySpark

items.topic: Confluent-Weaviate Connector with Embedded
items.description: This notebook shows you how to use the confluent-weaviate connector with Weaviate Embedded.

items.topic: Confluent-Weaviate Connector with Weaviate Cloud
items.description: This notebook shows you how to use the confluent-weaviate connector with Weaviate Cloud.

items.topic: Confluent-Weaviate Connector with Weaviate Cloud and Databricks
items.description: Learn how to integrate the confluent-weaviate connector with Weaviate Cloud and Databricks.

items.topic: Make Real-Time AI a Reality with Weaviate + Confluent
items.description: Learn how to build an application using Weaviate and Confluent.

items.topic: Introducing the New Weaviate Confluent Apache Kafka® Connector: Real-Time Vector Data Pipelines Made Easy
items.description: Learn about the new certified Weaviate Confluent Apache Kafka Connector!

name: Astronomer
description: Astronomer’s Astro is a fully managed platform built on top of Apache Airflow. It simplifies the management of Airflow at scale and data ingestion into Weaviate.
howItWorks: The Weaviate Airflow provider offers modules to easily integrate Weaviate with Airflow.
setup: Create and run a DAG to ingest data into Weaviate.
Use the WeaviateOperator to interact with your Weaviate instance directly from Airflow.

items.topic: Orchestrate Weaviate operations with Apache Airflow
items.description: Use Airflow to ingest movie descriptions into Weaviate and query the collection.

name: Databricks
description: Databricks is a data intelligence platform that unifies data, AI and governance on the lakehouse.
howItWorks: Databricks' Foundation Model APIs can be called directly from Weaviate, allowing you to use models hosted on the Databricks platform through the text2vec-databricks and generative-databricks modules.
howitWorksAdditional: Apache Spark (or the Python API, PySpark) is an open-source data processing framework used for real-time, large-scale data processing. You can ingest Spark data structures from Databricks into Weaviate using the Weaviate Spark connector. Learn more about the connector in the Weaviate Spark connector repository.
setup: Create a Databricks account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Databricks integration.
Configure the Weaviate Databricks Connector to stream data from Databricks to Weaviate.

items.topic: Weaviate Tutorial
items.description: Learn how to ingest data into Weaviate with Spark.

items.topic: Using the Spark Connector for Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to take data from a Spark dataframe and feed it into Weaviate.

items.topic: Ingest data from Spark into Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to ingest data from a Spark dataframe to Weaviate and use the text2vec-databricks and generative-databricks module.

items.topic: The Sphere Dataset in Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to import and query the Sphere dataset in Weaviate.

items.topic: The Details Behind the Sphere Dataset in Weaviate
items.description: The details on how we ingested ~1 billion article snippets into Weaviate.

items.topic: Build Scalable Gen AI Data Pipelines with Weaviate and Databricks
items.description: Learn how to build generative AI data pipelines at scale with Weaviate and Databricks

name: Unstructured
description: Unstructured offers a platform and tools to work with unstructured data. Ingest and process unstructured data to use in retrieval augmented generation (RAG) applications.
list:
1. Unstructured has two offerings:
  2. Unstructured Platform: No-code user interface
  3. Serverless API: Run scripts or code to call the Unstructured Ingest CLI
howItWorks: You can ingest and process data from a variety of sources into your Weaviate cluster. Weaviate is a destination connector in the Platform and API.
setup: Create an Unstructured account.
Set up a Weaviate instance.
Follow the instructions in the Weaviate documentation to connect Unstructured to Weaviate.

items.topic: Ingest Data from S3 into Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to use Unstructured's API to grab data from an S3 bucket and load it into Weaviate.

items.topic: Ingesting PDFs into Weaviate
items.description: Learn how to load and transform PDF documents into Weaviate.

name: Replicate
description: Replicate is a platform that allows users to run machine learning models through a cloud API. They host many open-source models, including embedding and language models. Users can run or fine-tune the models to meet their application needs.
howItWorks: To use models on Replicate, you need to use LlamaIndex or LangChain and connect it to your Weaviate vector store.
setup: Set up a Python environment.
Deploy a serverless, read-only Weaviate client with Replicate.
Integrate Replicate with Weaviate in your application.

items.topic: Run Llama 2 on Replicate
items.description: Build a LlamaIndex query engine using Replicate, Weaviate, and Llama 2 as the generative model.

name: Modal
description: Modal provides a serverless platform that has on-demand access to GPUs and a custom high-performance container runtime. Use Modal to easily deploy and automatically scale high-performance applications.
howItWorks: Weaviate leverages Modal's serverless infrastructure for fast embedding generation and generative model calls. To dynamically scale your application based on workload demands, host the Weaviate client on Modal.
setup: Set up a Python environment.
Deploy a serverless, read-only Weaviate client with Modal.
Integrate Modal with Weaviate in your application.

items.topic: Embed and Search Text at Scale with Modal and Weaviate
items.description: Build a full application that discovers analogies between Wikipedia articles. Combine serverless infrastructure from Modal with the search and storage capabilities of Weaviate.

items.topic: Embed and Search Text at Scale with Modal and Weaviate
items.description: Build a full application that discovers analogies between Wikipedia articles. Combine serverless infrastructure from Modal with the search and storage capabilities of Weaviate.

items.topic: Embed and Search Text at Scale with Modal and Weaviate
items.description: Build a full application that discovers analogies between Wikipedia articles. Combine serverless infrastructure from Modal with the search and storage capabilities of Weaviate.

name: Composio
description: Manage and integrate tools with language models and AI agents.

description: Build with Haystack for a simple way to build LLM applications.

description: Framework for building large language model (LLM) applications and ingesting data.

description: Framework for building large language models (LLM) applications.

name: DSPy
description: Framework for programming language model applications.

name: KubeAI
description: Run Open AI embedding and generative models on kubernetes.

name: Anyscale
description: Seamlessly connect to models on Anyscale directly from Weaviate.

name: FriendliAI
description: Access models on FriendliAI directly from Weaviate.

description: Access embedding models from Jina AI.

description: Access models on OctoAI directly from Weaviate.

description: Access Voyage AI’s models (embedding and reranker) directly from Weaviate.

description: Weave by W&B offers data analysis APIs for monitoring applications.

description: Connect LangWatch to your Weaviate instance to log operational traces.

description: View vector search queries and generative calls that are made to your Weaviate cluster

name: Arize AI
description: Log search queries sent to Weaviate and requests sent to LLM providers in Phoenix

name: IBM
description: IBM offers a variety of solutions for building generative AI applications and other use cases.
howItWorks: Docling is an open-source project built by the IBM Deep Search team. It enables developers to parse and export documents and ingest it into a Weaviate collection.
setup: Create a Docling account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Docling integration.
Configure the Weaviate Docling Connector to stream data from Docling to Weaviate.

items.description: This notebook shows you how to perform RAG over PDF documents parsed by Docling

name: DeepEval
description: Evaluate your generative AI applications with DeepEval's open-source LLM framework

name: Box
description: Box is a cloud-based content management platform that enables organizations to securely store, share, and collaborate on files.
howItWorks: By connecting Box with Weaviate, you can transform your stored files into a powerful semantic search system or enable Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG). This setup allows for advanced retrieval and AI-driven content generation based on your Box documents.
setup: Create a Box account and upload your documents.
Set up a Weaviate instance with the Box integration.
Configure the Box connector in Weaviate to access your Box files.
Ingest and index your Box documents into Weaviate for semantic search and RAG capabilities.

items.topic: Weaviate + Box RAG Demo
items.description: Learn how to embed the content stored in Box into Weaviate and then use the Query Agent to search through the documents.

name: NVIDIA
description: Connect to a variety of models on NVIDIA NIM

name: Dynamiq
description: Operating platform for agentic AI applications

name: CrewAI
description: LLM and Agent Framework for building multi-agent applications

name: Agno
description: A lightweight library for building Multimodal Agents

name: Boomi
description: Boomi is an integration platform as a service, API management, master data management and data preparation solution.
setup: Set up a Boomi account.
Create a new Boomi integration process.
Use the REST Client Connector to connect to your Weaviate instance.
Configure the connector to perform operations such as data ingestion and retrieval.
howItWorks: Weaviate is integrated into Boomi's platform through Boomi's REST Client Connector. This integration allows users to perform operations such as data ingestion and retrieval within Weaviate directly from Boomi's low-code environment.

items.topic: Start Connecting with Weaviate
items.description: A replication of Weaviate's Quickstart tutorial on the Boomi platform using the REST Client connector.

description: Leverage generative AI capabilities within the boundaries of your Snowflake data environment

name: TruLens
description: TruLens is an open source project for evaluating and tracking LLM applications

name: AIMon
description: AIMon offers monitoring and reranking tools to evaluate, optimize, and improve LLM applications

name: Cleanlab
description: Cleanlab provides software to detect and remediate inaccurate responses from Enterprise AI applications

name: Patronus AI
description: Patronus AI offers many tools and solutions for observability and evaluations

name: Comet
description: Comet allows you to track, evaluate, and monitor both traditional and LLM models end-to-end.

name: N8n
description: N8n is a low‑code workflow automation platform that lets users build generative AI applications.

name: Replicated
description: Replicated is a platform that helps software vendors package, deliver, and manage Kubernetes applications in secure, customer-controlled environments.
howItWorks: SecureBuild, by Replicated, offers a Weaviate container image for developers who want to run production‑ready Weaviate securely in local environments.
setup: Set up a Python environment.
Deploy a serverless, read-only Weaviate client with Replicated.
Integrate Replicated with Weaviate in your application.
